phrases: Oota.
Here!
Kawasaki.
Here!
Kimura.
Here!
Suzuki.
Here!
Sobukawa.
Here.
Takagi.
Here!
Takana.
Here!
Kobe.
Here!
Here, more plans.
'Kay.
It might be kind of a mixed bag, but this is what I chose for now.
What the heck is this?
It is terrible, but it is interesting!
People being able to change their bodies with their thoughts?
Horrible, is not it?
Well, I am aware it is not something suited for Jack.
There you are, Takagi!
Hey, Miyoshi!
Sorry for making you leave the other day.
Here.
It is today, after school.
To celebrate you coming back to school.
Cannot go.
Today we have a meeting for reviewing our work for the Tezuka Award at Yuueisha that we need to go to.
Then tomorrow?
I cannot.
Based on how the review meeting goes,
we will be starting on our next work right away.
Takagi...
You are going out with me, are not you?
Do not you remember...
I have a dream of becoming a mangaka.
Love takes second place to that!
Even if we are going out,
I will not have time for dates or anything!
That is fine.
I will support you.
Did not you say that?
But... cannot we, just for a little bit?
Do not you understand, Miyoshi?
I have a dream of becoming a mangaka,
and I do not want to trouble Saikou.
I do not have time for dates
But you will take a break once in a while, right?
Not right now.
Just for a teeny little bit?
Not even for a teeny little bit.
Not even for a teensy weensy little bit?
Not even for a teensy weensy little bit!
Sorry for the wait.
Good afternoon!
Thanks for working with us.
I forgot the screening comments.
Sorry, but could you come up with me?
Up?
You mean to the editorial department?
Yes.
You can get in as long as you have one of those.
Um...
Is it really all right for people like us to go in?
It is fine.
We even have grade schoolers and middle schoolers come in for field trips.
The Jack editorial department...
I am so excited!
You two, over here.
Ah, right.
First-timers are always surprised when they get off the elevator.
Well, here is the editorial department.
Hello, Shounen Jack editorial department.
When will the manuscript be up?
This is... the Jack editorial department!
It is kind of moving, is not it?
Sorry for taking so long.
Okay, how about that table in the front?
Alright!
The ones who judged them were Inagaki-sensei, Oda-sensei,
Toriyama-sensei, Kishimoto-sensei, Tezuka Productions,
Square's Editor-in-Chief, and our Editor-in-Chief.
TL Note: These are the mangakas of Eyeshield 21, One Piece, Dragonball, and Naruto, respectively.
TL Note: Square is a reference to Shuueisha's monthly magazine Jump Square.
That person...
He was at Uncle's funeral.
Mashiro-kun, are you listening?
Ah, yes!
Your results from the mangaka senseis were pretty good.
But they were not so good on the editorial department side.
Do you know why that is?
This will not be popular in Jack.
That is the viewpoint they are taking.
On the other hand, the senseis tend to give better scores to stories that are not Jack-like.
They are looking for originality, I suppose you could say.
Could you give me some examples of where it was not Jack-like?
It was the same with Futatsu no Chikyuu, but...
the main characters are normal humans.
Main characters with special abilities that act in a flashy manner are more Jack-like.
Of course, not all mangas can be like that.
Normal humans...
I knew it, you are saying it is still too much like a novel?
Yeah... but that is just kind of your style, Takagi-kun.
However, there is no doubt that the protagonist had a weak character.
Um...
My artwork was no good, was not it?
That is not true.
On the screening comments, you received more fours than threes on the scale out of five.
It looks like they think you can still grow,
so they put threes in order keep you from being satisfied with where you are.
If you keep drawing, you will get much, much better.
You are doing fine.
What a relief...
I am not holding Shuujin back.
Even so, these are incredible scores.
You just had bad luck this time.
A boy named Niizuma Eiji won the prize and took the finalist slot.
If he was not there,
you would have moved up and definitely would have gotten an honorable mention.
He sure is amazing, this Niizuma Eiji guy.
He really is, beyond amazing.
He is the kind of outstanding talent that only shows up once every ten years.
The truth is, he is already left Aomori and is getting ready to be serialized.
Serialized?!
Can a high schooler get serialized?!
They can.
I thought that you knew, Mashiro-kun.
If you are only drawing the characters
and having the finishing touches done by assistants,
roughly how much time do you think it would save?
In that case, it would cut the time by a fourth...
No, a fifth.
Yes.
In terms of drawings, it is not impossible.
Especially for Niizuma-kun who has been submitting one work a month all by himself.
Every month?
What is more, they were winners and finals...
Well, Niizuma-kun's case aside...
Going by these comments and my own thoughts,
what it is lacking as a Shounen magazine, is an appealing Jack-like protagonist.
If you just had that, I am sure you will place next time.
Also, Niizuma-kun will not be aiming for any more prizes.
Niizuma Eiji is already getting ready to be serialized...
Yet we are still...
I said before, you should plan on appearing in NEXT!, but
it may be better to try to win the monthly award.
If you can win that, it will be run in the magazine as your debut work.
Okay.
Is that the shortest route to serialization?
For example,
if we wrote a manuscript with the aim to be serialized,
and that was judged to be at serialization level,
then it would be serialized, right?
Saikou, we are still...
I do not mind, but in that case you need to write a minimum of three chapters.
Since it is you two, they cannot be names, they will have to be manuscripts that
So if they are interesting, will it get serialized?
Whether they are interesting or not, it might just get ignored.
It may not even be sent into the serialization meeting.
If you are too full of yourselves, they might even tear up your manuscript and
That is not so.
Editor-in-Chief!
SSo this person was the Editor-in-Chief?!
A manga only needs to be interesting.
If it is interesting, of course it will get serialized.
But... your work is not interesting.
At your present level, it is impossible for you to be serialized.
As long as it is interesting, it is fine.
Interesting works will be serialized.
Those were also the last words the mangaka Kawaguchi Tarou said to me.
He knows about me?
When I notified Kawaguchi-san that he was being dismissed from the magazine,
that is what he told me.
Dismissed from the magazine?
Authors at Jack are paid a yearly contract fee.
Should you really be saying that?
These children are seriously aiming to become pros, are not they?
Then there is no reason to hide the truth from them.
The amount of money is less, but you can think of it like a baseball player's salary.
If they continue to be serialized,
that year's contract fees and manuscript fees are decided...
in relation to how much they have contributed each year and such.
But if that series ends,
if the author is not able to produce any more good works afterwards,
they are indirectly told, Jack does not need you anymore.
Then their contract is terminated.
When Kawaguchi-san dragged himself here
to receive his notice of dismissal...
I was an assistant editor-in-chief.
Sorry to keep you waiting.
So that is how it is, huh?
Kawaguchi-san, with your series Chou Hero Densetsu
No need to be so delicate about it.
Rather, having been pretty obscure for seven years since then, I...
You cannot be...
I feel relieved.
I can come in with something as a newcomer again.
A manga just needs to be interesting.
If it is interesting, it will get serialized.
After that, he started bringing works in without caring about his appearance.
It seems that five days before he died,
he came in, not with a name, but with a manuscript.
Um...
Is it true that Niizuma Eiji is already preparing to be serialized?
Yes, it is true.
What do you think is the biggest difference between us and Niizuma-san?
To put it into a phrase...
it is how much you love manga.
We like manga too!
I know that.
But he does so to an abnormal level.
He is used a pen ever since he was six years old and has been drawing ever since.
Even when we went to greet his parents,
he never once put his pen down.
Without thinking about anything,
as normal as it was for him to breath,
he drew manga matching with the pulse of today.
I think that once his serialization starts, he will get to a certain height very quickly.
But for now, that level will not be number one.
He will not be number one?
It is because he is young.
He is all vigor and no depth.
He will be popular with kids, but it will not be enough for Jack's readership of middle schoolers.
That is it, is not it?!
What?
The stories in these two's work is deep for their age, elaborate even.
Yes, it could be a little simpler.
Depth...
Story...
Takagi-kun, Mashrio-kun,
from now on it is fine for you to just bring me names.
An appealing Jack-like protagonist.
Just be careful with that.
Just keep bringing them in.
Then how about we decide between the three of us which one you should draw?
Just names?
Yes.
Honestly, your drawings are only going to get better.
It is not like they will ever be totally bad.
It is more a matter of the story!
If we do it that way, I do not mind if you aim to be in Jack NEXT!.
I think you are right.
Show them as names.
First, make one interesting manga with Hattori.
That is what you would call the shortest route towards serialization.
All right?
Yes sir!
Editor-in-Chief.
Why did you suddenly start talking about someone from so long ago, like Kawaguchi Tarou?
I saw the last name Mashiro and the address, I thought it might be possible...
he is Kawaguchi Tarou's nephew.
You were his editor?
Yes.
But even so, it makes no difference.
He is going to look at them as names.
We have taken another step forward!
Yeah.
First, make one interesting manga with Hattori.
That is what you would call the shortest route towards serialization.
From now on, it is fine for you to just bring names.
Then how about we decide between the three of us which one you should draw?
It kind of feels like the pressure's even greater now.
But I believe in Hattori-san.
Huh?
Shuujin's already here?
Shuujin...
Saikou, good morning.
Sorry...
What?
The two of us have not been doing anything weird together.
Not that.
Sorry, I did not realize until after I let her in.
What?
I told you this place used to belong to Mashiro's uncle, who was a mangaka, did not I?
Yeah, so?
Saikou does not want Azuki to know that.
Why?
It does not matter, does it?
It is not like you are doing anything wrong.
Yeah, but...
I just really do not...
Pride is a difficult subject.
Pride, huh?
But I heard everything from Miho.
You are not going to go out together until you are both successful?
That is totally weird!
You are going to get married when you succeed?
I did not think Azuki would tell Miyoshi everything.
What?
Nothing.
It has nothing to do with you, Miyoshi.
Yes it does!
I am Miho's best friend.
It is almost Christmas!
What are you two doing?
Who are you calling?
Miho, of course.
Ah, Miho!
I am with Takagi and Mashiro right now.
Why do not you come too?
The four of us can
Hey, stop!
She said no.
It should be clear that neither of us can do that.
Neither me nor Azuki.
Why does not she know that much?
I know Miho's shy and kind of spontaneous, but
I am really having a hard time understanding this.
Getting married when her dream comes true.
Are not we still in the third year of middle school?
How could she promise she is going to get married?
Takagi, are you thinking about marrying me right now?
Not at all.
You are... so mean.
The way the conversation was going, that should not have been the wrong answer!
Your sudden refusal pissed me off.
Especially saying Not at all like that.
Hey, Miyoshi, it is something Saikou and Azuki decided together.
That is why I told you not to interfere.
I sort of see where they are coming from.
What is wrong with being romantic?
Then, Takagi, if I were to say that I could not see you until you became a mangaka, what would you do?
I cannot answer.
Your answer would just make me kick you again, would not it?!
It would not be, I would hate to do that, right?
Or like, I would not care?!
Saikou, help me!
Hey, Saikou!
That is enough you two, cut it out.
Anyway, I would really prefer it if you did not tell Miyoshi about this apartment at all.
Right, all you need to do is ask and I will break up with Miyoshi.
All right, I will not tell her.
And Shuujin, do not let Miyoshi in here without my permission anymore.
Sorry, got it.
But you guys are always going to come here to draw manga, right?!
We will not even be able to date on Saturdays!
You said that you were fine with that before, did not you?
Do not make me keep saying it.
But...
I guess you can come on holidays.
You can meet at school on regular days, right?
Really?
Yay!
What?
If I look closely at you, Saikou-kun, you have got a pretty cute face.
I was just thinking, Miho's taste is not bad.
Thanks...
Hachiouji?
It is some kind of all-girls school.
Miho said she is going there.
But Hachiouji?
That is pretty far from here.
She said that it is close to a production company she goes to for lessons.
While she is going through high school,
she is probably going to try selling herself as an idol before going for seiyuu.
Seriously?
She is not going to become a gravure idol or something, right?
I do not know, but I do not think he would like that, as her boyfriend.
Azuki would never do stuff like that.
Alright, Shuujin, let us work on the name.
None of these are interesting!
Why, I wonder?
I mean, they definitely all have Jack-like protagonists...
That is it!
They are too normal.
Too normal?
They are too Jack-like.
All they leave is an impression that they are lacking something.
By trying too hard to make a mainstream hero,
it is even taking away from the story.
With this, you are not even going to beat the newcomers, let alone Niizuma Eiji.
No way!
I am sorry!
I was doing things the wrong way.
You two are not suited for mainstream.
I firmly understand that now.
Is not that fatal for Jack?!
What should we do?
First we are told that we cannot become popular in Jack...
Then we get told that being too Jack-like is not good.
So... what should we do?
I am going.
From Hattori-san?
Yeah.
He asked if we could come after school today.
What do we do?
Sorry to keep you waiting.
Sorry for having you leave so fast before.
Ah, it is fine.
Thanks for working with us...
This is sudden, but you know about reader questionnaires?
Yeah, I know about them.
With the questionnaire postcards attached in every Jack,
the mangas are given their rank.
Yes.
The truth is, if just two out of every ten people choose a manga, that manga is considered popular.
Only two?
Yes.
You only need twenty percent.
Why is he suddenly giving us a frank talk like this?
We talked about how Takagi's strength was making non-childish stories.
But because I tried to make you more mainstream,
in the end, all it did was destroy that strength.
Let us change what road we are taking.
Instead of aiming for universal popularity,
even if more than half of the readers do not think it is interesting,
do a manga that you are sure at least two out of ten people will definitely think is interesting.
If Niizuma-kun is mainstream, then this would be cult.
I want you to aim for that kind of work.
Just be aware,
there is a smaller number of mangas in Jack NEXT!
than there is in the main magazine,
so twenty percent will not be good enough,
but if a work gets twenty percent in the main magazine,
they will definitely get good results.
Actually, since it is NEXT!,
there will be some that are not that good, so it is fine to try standing out.
Instead of mainstream... cult?
An all-or-nothing gamble manga!
Could you be a little more specific about it?
Do not you have any name that would not work in Jack,
or that you thought the readers would not like or something?
Well...
There is this one that a good-looking high school student seriously competes to see how many girls he can date...
Yes!
Ones like that!
Something that is general frowned upon,
but definitely has some people that would like it!
There is that one, Shuujin.
The one about people buying people's thoughts with money and trying to get to the top.
What?
That is perfect!
It sounds terrible!
Tell me more!
Well, right now cell phones can exchange information using infrared, right?
In the near future, people's brains can do that too, and thoughts can be also be bought and sold.
Of course, smart people's thoughts are expensive and that is the only thing that has value.
You need money to buy them, so you need to sell your own to as many people as you can.
If you sell them to worse people, then they move up.
If you are selling, you want it to be as expensive as possible for people stupider than you.
If you are buying, you want it to be as cheap as possible from people smarter than you.
That is it!
Something like that is a definite Yes!
In fact, why did not you draw that and bring it in to me sooner?
Well, I thought we were going for mainstream.
By the way, what is your title for that?
It is a a little creepy, but Kono Yo Wa Kane to Chie.
TL Note: Kono Yo Wa Kane to Chie = This World is Money and Intelligence
Then it is decided.
Let us go with that!
I think this is the only road we can take to make use of your unique characteristics.
I want to get your work serialized.
Let us have the three of us work on a name,
and get it done in time for NEXT!.
The deadline is February thirteenth.
Yes, sir!
Niizuma-kun, are you ready for the serialization?
The truth is, I would actually like you to begin with a one-shot... huh?
Niizuma-kun...
Next time, Chocolate and NEXT!.
NEXT! is a dream for newcomer mangakas!
